intro: Apteranthes europaea var. micrantha, commonly known as the European dwarf bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features basal rosettes of narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue or violet, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This variety is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments.
